H4DFDC59F718C4536A4A9F3A7BC1BD257.text: This Act may be cited as the “Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency Act of 2018”.
H4DFDC59F718C4536A4A9F3A7BC1BD257.author: olrcdev

H2F44D10D26F14E9FA5F115E8AEF7CF26.text: The Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 101 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:
H2F44D10D26F14E9FA5F115E8AEF7CF26.xml_card:
Sec. 2. Cybersecurity and infrastructure security agency(a) In general.—

The Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 101 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

<num value="XXII">“Title XXII—</num><heading>Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency</heading><subtitle identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA" id="H59C7F88A38C7494685D7F4425AA8BEA5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1"><num value="A">“Subtitle A—</num><heading>Cybersecurity and infrastructure security</heading><section identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201" id="H9C658879ED2143C68CB32217B4169B34" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1"><num value="2201">“Sec. 2201.</num><heading> Definitions</heading><chapeau class="block">In this subtitle:</chapeau><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/1" id="HECB492222008487E92C3CC2D51CB15D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1"><num value="1">“(1)</num><heading> Critical infrastructure information.—</heading><content>The term <quotedContent>‘critical infrastructure information’</quotedContent> has the meaning given the term in section 2222.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/2" id="H13114989ECA84338B727BC7AEA109FF1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1"><num value="2">“(2)</num><heading> Cybersecurity risk.—</heading><content>The term <quotedContent>‘cybersecurity risk’</quotedContent> has the meaning given the term in section 2209.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/3" id="HC0499333870D420BACF72D0A91344374" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1"><num value="3">“(3)</num><heading> Cybersecurity threat.—</heading><content>The term <quotedContent>‘cybersecurity threat’</quotedContent> has the meaning given the term in section 102(5) of the Cybersecurity Act of 2015 (contained in division N of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2016 (<ref href="/us/pl/114/113">Public Law 114–113</ref>; <ref href="/us/usc/6/1501">6 U.S.C. 1501</ref>)).</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/4" id="H6D5EB041FE76471BA7FF4FA5BCC135C7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1"><num value="4">“(4)</num><heading> National cybersecurity asset response activities.—</heading><chapeau>The term <quotedContent>‘national cybersecurity asset response activities’</quotedContent> means—</chapeau><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/4/A" id="H930681801174495F801A0CD72CED6AC8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1"><num value="A">“(A)</num><content> furnishing cybersecurity technical assistance to entities affected by cybersecurity risks to protect assets, mitigate vulnerabilities, and reduce impacts of cyber incidents;</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/4/B" id="H0C2CCD704DB649639D026846F5A2D2C6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1"><num value="B">“(B)</num><content> identifying other entities that may be at risk of an incident and assessing risk to the same or similar vulnerabilities;</content></subparagraph><?page 2?><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/4/C" id="H95030249A3DC4DE8AFC069218CC16BDA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="C">“(C)</num><content> assessing potential cybersecurity risks to a sector or region, including potential cascading effects, and developing courses of action to mitigate such risks;</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/4/D" id="H937D11193FB04DE5915411E72811E44A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="D">“(D)</num><content> facilitating information sharing and operational coordination with threat response; and</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/4/E" id="H898DA4F20DD942F4BB765B76E9D08D16" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="E">“(E)</num><content> providing guidance on how best to utilize Federal resources and capabilities in a timely, effective manner to speed recovery from cybersecurity risks.</content></subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/5" id="H3EA2AE4A4BFD438587AFFD31CD93A46A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="5">“(5)</num><heading> Sector-specific agency.—</heading><content>The term <quotedContent>‘Sector-Specific Agency’</quotedContent> means a Federal department or agency, designated by law or presidential directive, with responsibility for providing institutional knowledge and specialized expertise of a sector, as well as leading, facilitating, or supporting programs and associated activities of its designated critical infrastructure sector in the all hazards environment in coordination with the Department.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2201/6" id="HA4C67F37C95D4019BFFDA288969EE533" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="6">“(6)</num><heading> Sharing.—</heading><content>The term <quotedContent>‘sharing’</quotedContent> has the meaning given the term in section 2209.</content></paragraph></section><section identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202" id="H840570DC93114AEEBABE8AF9D64D8B28" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="2202">“Sec. 2202.</num><heading> Cybersecurity and infrastructure security agency</heading><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/a" id="HF12F421303C04CA5ABB7162496769100" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="a">“(a)</num><heading> Redesignation.—</heading><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/a/1" id="H77ECDC9178A0409FAD4AE8B5D4E6AA5F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="1">“(1)</num><heading> In general.—</heading><content>The National Protection and Programs Directorate of the Department shall, on and after the date of the enactment of this subtitle, be known as the <quotedContent>‘Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency’</quotedContent> (in this subtitle referred to as the <quotedContent>‘Agency’</quotedContent>).</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/a/2" id="H3F19067DCB0C495A85DD1A7B312FD8DC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="2">“(2)</num><heading> References.—</heading><content>Any reference to the National Protection and Programs Directorate of the Department in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency of the Department.</content></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/b" id="H677438B161EA4D7098314F94412CCB11" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="b">“(b)</num><heading> Director.—</heading><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/b/1" id="HE3130BB31C3847CEBF218F3E520762AB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="1">“(1)</num><heading> In general.—</heading><content>The Agency shall be headed by a Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security (in this subtitle referred to as the <quotedContent>‘Director’</quotedContent>), who shall report to the Secretary.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/b/2" id="H9A2028D195CA45CAB26E3EE98631529D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="2">“(2)</num><heading> Reference.—</heading><content>Any reference to an Under Secretary responsible for overseeing critical infrastructure protection, cybersecurity, and any other related program of the Department as described in section 103(a)(1)(H) as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of this subtitle in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security of the Department.</content></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c" id="HF7AE3B9F29674D7ABE50074A4BEB0761" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="c">“(c)</num><heading> Responsibilities.—</heading><chapeau>The Director shall—</chapeau><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/1" id="H831EAE43D025454483F8FF8079426182" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="1">“(1)</num><content> lead cybersecurity and critical infrastructure security programs, operations, and associated policy for the Agency, including national cybersecurity asset response activities;</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/2" id="H2F24370073754D82B91E897C66B079DF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="2">“(2)</num><content> coordinate with Federal entities, including Sector-Specific Agencies, and non-Federal entities, including international entities, to carry out the cybersecurity and critical infrastructure activities of the Agency, as appropriate;</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/3" id="H489503599EAD42C188323DBF3710F7B7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2"><num value="3">“(3)</num><content> carry out the responsibilities of the Secretary to secure Federal information and information systems consistent with law, including subchapter II of <ref href="/us/usc-chapter/44/35">chapter 35</ref> of title 44, United States Code, and the Cybersecurity Act of 2015 (contained <?page 3?>in division N of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2016 (<ref href="/us/pl/114/113">Public Law 114–113</ref>));</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/4" id="H5C4C165774244C8E849AB901BF31815D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="4">“(4)</num><content> coordinate a national effort to secure and protect against critical infrastructure risks, consistent with subsection (e)(1)(E);</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/5" id="H7C0B8B063AD94C75B3EE9A5998DF263E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="5">“(5)</num><content> upon request, provide analyses, expertise, and other technical assistance to critical infrastructure owners and operators and, where appropriate, provide those analyses, expertise, and other technical assistance in coordination with Sector-Specific Agencies and other Federal departments and agencies;</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/6" id="H4805A5FD17D244C0A020CFC1EDC63996" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="6">“(6)</num><content> develop and utilize mechanisms for active and frequent collaboration between the Agency and Sector-Specific Agencies to ensure appropriate coordination, situational awareness, and communications with Sector-Specific Agencies;</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/7" id="H0178718F43B042D288E2AC261DA04007" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="7">“(7)</num><content> maintain and utilize mechanisms for the regular and ongoing consultation and collaboration among the Divisions of the Agency to further operational coordination, integrated situational awareness, and improved integration across the Agency in accordance with this Act;</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/8" id="H9224D10E65B649638239058E2FDBEB81" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="8">“(8)</num><chapeau> develop, coordinate, and implement—</chapeau><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/8/A" id="HDBE48EEA00694932B0E83B5700BA0D83" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="A">“(A)</num><content> comprehensive strategic plans for the activities of the Agency; and</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/8/B" id="H6B1FE0F0877E49EE99D9E0479D1D3DE2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="B">“(B)</num><content> risk assessments by and for the Agency;</content></subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/9" id="HE996CAD0950B41EF82965DBE79C38EF5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="9">“(9)</num><content> carry out emergency communications responsibilities, in accordance with title XVIII;</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/10" id="H5616F2045A3E4CFAB6ED21CD435C8B57" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="10">“(10)</num><content> carry out cybersecurity, infrastructure security, and emergency communications stakeholder outreach and engagement and coordinate that outreach and engagement with critical infrastructure Sector-Specific Agencies, as appropriate; and</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/c/11" id="H14EECA30BFA749DD83AE6E43566B98B5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="11">“(11)</num><content> carry out such other duties and powers prescribed by law or delegated by the Secretary.</content></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/d" id="HAAADA6E4E94248209C8195120D9F9972" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="d">“(d)</num><heading> Deputy director.—</heading><chapeau>There shall be in the Agency a Deputy Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security who shall—</chapeau><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/d/1" id="HDE2075E2B6044E5592C84FBFBC44B973" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="1">“(1)</num><content> assist the Director in the management of the Agency; and</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/d/2" id="H5879C3DFEEF745DF9F25D9B586E6C9B3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="2">“(2)</num><content> report to the Director.</content></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e" id="HEFB79AF98CB74FAD8C94D63428ED84AC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="e">“(e)</num><heading> Cybersecurity and infrastructure security authorities of the secretary.—</heading><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1" id="HA5C6866C53E04E63B97D1BB9DFE476F6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="1">“(1)</num><heading> In general.—</heading><chapeau>The responsibilities of the Secretary relating to cybersecurity and infrastructure security shall include the following:</chapeau><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/A" id="HCEE9433F22F54AE584C77E341FB9DABC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="A">“(A)</num><chapeau> To access, receive, and analyze law enforcement information, intelligence information, and other information from Federal Government agencies, State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies, including law enforcement agencies, and private sector entities, and to integrate that information, in support of the mission responsibilities of the Department, in order to—</chapeau><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/A/i" id="HD1E58A1B43D34C508D599C16470889B7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="i">“(i)</num><content> identify and assess the nature and scope of terrorist threats to the homeland;</content></clause><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/A/ii" id="H6BD32304EFE74E19AF70BBB245404050" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="ii">“(ii)</num><content> detect and identify threats of terrorism against the United States; and</content></clause><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/A/iii" id="H8BC8739BBCDA43659CEED79F53DC8E6D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="iii">“(iii)</num><content> understand those threats in light of actual and potential vulnerabilities of the homeland.</content></clause></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/B" id="H3612C626601B4429995E5236E556434F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="3"><num value="B">“(B)</num><content> To carry out comprehensive assessments of the vulnerabilities of the key resources and critical infrastructure of the United States, including the performance of <?page 4?>risk assessments to determine the risks posed by particular types of terrorist attacks within the United States, including an assessment of the probability of success of those attacks and the feasibility and potential efficacy of various countermeasures to those attacks. At the discretion of the Secretary, such assessments may be carried out in coordination with Sector-Specific Agencies.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/C" id="HDE397E35BC0342E489524245E5569BE4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="4"><num value="C">“(C)</num><content> To integrate relevant information, analysis, and vulnerability assessments, regardless of whether the information, analysis, or assessments are provided or produced by the Department, in order to make recommendations, including prioritization, for protective and support measures by the Department, other Federal Government agencies, State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and authorities, the private sector, and other entities regarding terrorist and other threats to homeland security.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/D" id="H4993CE185A614FD280A4DB3C90CDB9BF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="4"><num value="D">“(D)</num><content> To ensure, pursuant to section 202, the timely and efficient access by the Department to all information necessary to discharge the responsibilities under this title, including obtaining that information from other Federal Government agencies.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/E" id="HCAA311F414B64E8E89FCB2AE68FF4BE3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="4"><num value="E">“(E)</num><content> To develop, in coordination with the Sector-Specific Agencies with available expertise, a comprehensive national plan for securing the key resources and critical infrastructure of the United States, including power production, generation, and distribution systems, information technology and telecommunications systems (including satellites), electronic financial and property record storage and transmission systems, emergency communications systems, and the physical and technological assets that support those systems.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/F" id="HA0BD8BE129F54A27B96B50BAF657AC0D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="4"><num value="F">“(F)</num><content> To recommend measures necessary to protect the key resources and critical infrastructure of the United States in coordination with other Federal Government agencies, including Sector-Specific Agencies, and in cooperation with State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and authorities, the private sector, and other entities.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/G" id="H7B7C809666B140E194961EA49D680A39" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="4"><num value="G">“(G)</num><content> To review, analyze, and make recommendations for improvements to the policies and procedures governing the sharing of information relating to homeland security within the Federal Government and between Federal Government agencies and State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and authorities.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/H" id="H21B52E32087A481CB56DE3979A262D24" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="4"><num value="H">“(H)</num><content> To disseminate, as appropriate, information analyzed by the Department within the Department to other Federal Government agencies with responsibilities relating to homeland security and to State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and private sector entities with those responsibilities in order to assist in the deterrence, prevention, or preemption of, or response to, terrorist attacks against the United States.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/I" id="HA8665B7BBF264C699CCC8DCC159AFE8A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="4"><num value="I">“(I)</num><content> To consult with State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and private sector entities to ensure appropriate exchanges of information, including law <?page 5?>enforcement-related information, relating to threats of terrorism against the United States.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/J" id="H9DF52D8B26B64336ADC486103D59A0BF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="J">“(J)</num><content> To ensure that any material received pursuant to this Act is protected from unauthorized disclosure and handled and used only for the performance of official duties.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/K" id="HFEDC2A5D6A5C46839B1FD24D062F90E0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="K">“(K)</num><content> To request additional information from other Federal Government agencies, State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies, and the private sector relating to threats of terrorism in the United States, or relating to other areas of responsibility assigned by the Secretary, including the entry into cooperative agreements through the Secretary to obtain such information.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/L" id="H73EBA428C7D046B4B7E0C529A38C8B2D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="L">“(L)</num><content> To establish and utilize, in conjunction with the Chief Information Officer of the Department, a secure communications and information technology infrastructure, including data-mining and other advanced analytical tools, in order to access, receive, and analyze data and information in furtherance of the responsibilities under this section, and to disseminate information acquired and analyzed by the Department, as appropriate.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/M" id="H4915B698DC1346CDB8EB7311A06177A0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="M">“(M)</num><content> To coordinate training and other support to the elements and personnel of the Department, other Federal Government agencies, and State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies that provide information to the Department, or are consumers of information provided by the Department, in order to facilitate the identification and sharing of information revealed in their ordinary duties and the optimal utilization of information received from the Department.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/N" id="H9A95D6CE7608475DA42434A7598AF746" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="N">“(N)</num><content> To coordinate with Federal, State, local, tribal, and territorial law enforcement agencies, and the private sector, as appropriate.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/O" id="H6FF4386C050746BBA6DC05848C69FAB1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="O">“(O)</num><content> To exercise the authorities and oversight of the functions, personnel, assets, and liabilities of those components transferred to the Department pursuant to section 201(g).</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/P" id="H7D185EA529AC488399062558BB89ED92" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="P">“(P)</num><content> To carry out the functions of the national cybersecurity and communications integration center under section 2209.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/1/Q" id="H8523CA64BA7F49C48976F713D7C06B44" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="Q">“(Q)</num><content> To carry out the requirements of the Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism Standards Program established under title XXI and the secure handling of ammonium nitrate program established under subtitle J of title VIII, or any successor programs.</content></subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/2" id="H6A5836E5685D4EEBBEFA6DB42C165105" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="2">“(2)</num><heading> Reallocation.—</heading><content>The Secretary may reallocate within the Agency the functions specified in sections 2203(b) and 2204(b), consistent with the responsibilities provided in paragraph (1), upon certifying to and briefing the appropriate congressional committees, and making available to the public, at least 60 days prior to the reallocation that the reallocation is necessary for carrying out the activities of the Agency.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/3" id="H057FF1ADECC444619F61FF79D6E45996" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="3">“(3)</num><heading> Staff.—</heading><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/3/A" id="H849ACDC1E8064F73B599CED6C6162A5F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="5"><num value="A">“(A)</num><heading> In general.—</heading><content>The Secretary shall provide the Agency with a staff of analysts having appropriate expertise and experience to assist the Agency in discharging the responsibilities of the Agency under this section.</content></subparagraph><?page 6?><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/3/B" id="H2A8CA82EC43F40A78F4F1490E2A5C32C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="B">“(B)</num><heading> Private sector analysts.—</heading><content>Analysts under this subsection may include analysts from the private sector.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/3/C" id="HAB526A5AF8D648008D5DDD1C7D145112" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="C">“(C)</num><heading> Security clearances.—</heading><content>Analysts under this subsection shall possess security clearances appropriate for their work under this section.</content></subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4" id="H40B8A4F5FB1A4A4691F82C588331C629" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="4">“(4)</num><heading> Detail of personnel.—</heading><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/A" id="H495018EA54C54667A07CDA9708514ED8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="A">“(A)</num><heading> In general.—</heading><content>In order to assist the Agency in discharging the responsibilities of the Agency under this section, personnel of the Federal agencies described in subparagraph (B) may be detailed to the Agency for the performance of analytic functions and related duties.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/B" id="H2D65EA1C9FA84B9ABF75DC0C8DF14E84" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="B">“(B)</num><heading> Agencies.—</heading><chapeau>The Federal agencies described in this subparagraph are—</chapeau><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/B/i" id="HA6B28D7D3B9145CDB0E0F7F678A04AA1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="i">“(i)</num><content> the Department of State;</content></clause><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/B/ii" id="HCE420DCD660E4C49B19932EFB3E2FEDB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="ii">“(ii)</num><content> the Central Intelligence Agency;</content></clause><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/B/iii" id="H274E8DE830974015BF11439F0C640EAA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="iii">“(iii)</num><content> the Federal Bureau of Investigation;</content></clause><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/B/iv" id="H2C19EC9616894238B83B44E8C409D156" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="iv">“(iv)</num><content> the National Security Agency;</content></clause><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/B/v" id="HDA85251A1CB14E819EE858F5EA239B3D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="v">“(v)</num><content> the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency;</content></clause><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/B/vi" id="H77F9125290644B248716A4C160DE2307" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="vi">“(vi)</num><content> the Defense Intelligence Agency;</content></clause><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/B/vii" id="HE779BE37585C4CA6992591C83ADECE08" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="vii">“(vii)</num><content> Sector-Specific Agencies; and</content></clause><clause identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/B/viii" id="H055797742945489F82C2BB13E07C351A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="viii">“(viii)</num><content> any other agency of the Federal Government that the President considers appropriate.</content></clause></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/C" id="H742251398D8B4645BC45B828078CF97A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="C">“(C)</num><heading> Interagency agreements.—</heading><content>The Secretary and the head of a Federal agency described in subparagraph (B) may enter into agreements for the purpose of detailing personnel under this paragraph.</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/e/4/D" id="HB5A918633DFE4313BFAF47174F7875F1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="D">“(D)</num><heading> Basis.—</heading><content>The detail of personnel under this paragraph may be on a reimbursable or non-reimbursable basis.</content></subparagraph></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/f" id="H2D79DEDE767A49D78E92EC2553E620D4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="f">“(f)</num><heading> Composition.—</heading><chapeau>The Agency shall be composed of the following divisions:</chapeau><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/f/1" id="HA27D01C93E8E41268BC59D8AF991D941" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="1">“(1)</num><content> The Cybersecurity Division, headed by an Assistant Director.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/f/2" id="HD6B1726E7F4347B6B47B6FA7A586A735" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="2">“(2)</num><content> The Infrastructure Security Division, headed by an Assistant Director.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/f/3" id="H42196CEF3FC042B18F10F7860C4254DB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="3">“(3)</num><content> The Emergency Communications Division under title XVIII, headed by an Assistant Director.</content></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/g" id="HB7B0F40F2F3743DBA3FE9CEF6FFB27CE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="g">“(g)</num><heading> Co-location.—</heading><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/g/1" id="H9DF9EF0AB1D84759AA94847B7DAF5D3A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="1">“(1)</num><heading> In general.—</heading><content>To the maximum extent practicable, the Director shall examine the establishment of central locations in geographical regions with a significant Agency presence.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/g/2" id="HC519B4DC23D247849FA753247B1B78EA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="2">“(2)</num><heading> Coordination.—</heading><content>When establishing the central locations described in paragraph (1), the Director shall coordinate with component heads and the Under Secretary for Management to co-locate or partner on any new real property leases, renewing any occupancy agreements for existing leases, or agreeing to extend or newly occupy any Federal space or new construction.</content></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/h" id="H431B4DA75DC74396B0219F3FDDD749A2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="h">“(h)</num><heading> Privacy.—</heading><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/h/1" id="HD22A32E7211F49B397CB0EFC6449024A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="1">“(1)</num><heading> In general.—</heading><content>There shall be a Privacy Officer of the Agency with primary responsibility for privacy policy and compliance for the Agency.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/h/2" id="H6B7B27D3221244F19DC45EACF2070F18" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="2">“(2)</num><heading> Responsibilities.—</heading><chapeau>The responsibilities of the Privacy Officer of the Agency shall include—</chapeau><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/h/2/A" id="H4BEAAED4595A45A8A9318EF54814700C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="6"><num value="A">“(A)</num><content> assuring that the use of technologies by the Agency sustain, and do not erode, privacy protections relating to the use, collection, and disclosure of personal information;</content></subparagraph><?page 7?><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/h/2/B" id="HD433FF2B4B304961B3B6718ED8AF77B7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="B">“(B)</num><content> assuring that personal information contained in systems of records of the Agency is handled in full compliance as specified in section 552a of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the <quotedContent>‘Privacy Act of 1974’</quotedContent>);</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/h/2/C" id="H7334B9AF28A64AF292BA5443FBCE40B5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="C">“(C)</num><content> evaluating legislative and regulatory proposals involving collection, use, and disclosure of personal information by the Agency; and</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/h/2/D" id="H35167F8072B34E5FAF2714AA302B2D8B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="D">“(D)</num><content> conducting a privacy impact assessment of proposed rules of the Agency on the privacy of personal information, including the type of personal information collected and the number of people affected.</content></subparagraph></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2202/i" id="HC4776D038BE84FCAA5A9410E8F590579" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="i">“(i)</num><heading> Savings.—</heading><content>Nothing in this title may be construed as affecting in any manner the authority, existing on the day before the date of enactment of this title, of any other component of the Department or any other Federal department or agency, including the authority provided to the Sector-Specific Agency specified in section 61003(c) of division F of the Fixing America’s Surface Transportation Act (<ref href="/us/usc/6/121">6 U.S.C. 121</ref> note; <ref href="/us/pl/114/94">Public Law 114–94</ref>).</content></subsection></section><section identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203" id="H918D2366FA4E4390AA8C5F2FD727D07D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="2203">“Sec. 2203.</num><heading> Cybersecurity division</heading><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/a" id="H733B6C7996204B7E83EBDD9E1978028A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="a">“(a)</num><heading> Establishment.—</heading><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/a/1" id="HF4F4D59573CF4AEC819BB43380B75090" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="1">“(1)</num><heading> In general.—</heading><content>There is established in the Agency a Cybersecurity Division.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/a/2" id="H7E9BDA64235A4365B8BDC980ED430B39" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="2">“(2)</num><heading> Assistant director.—</heading><chapeau>The Cybersecurity Division shall be headed by an Assistant Director for Cybersecurity (in this section referred to as the <quotedContent>‘Assistant Director’</quotedContent>), who shall—</chapeau><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/a/2/A" id="H8ED5ED65EED54405B44AAF872B20BDD6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="A">“(A)</num><content> be at the level of Assistant Secretary within the Department;</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/a/2/B" id="HCDF9A8EB5E7846AFA2A5D6C578B86549" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="B">“(B)</num><content> be appointed by the President without the advice and consent of the Senate; and</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/a/2/C" id="H357D954351FB405585A3F2E30F1BF7D9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="C">“(C)</num><content> report to the Director.</content></subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/a/3" id="H708F635802C9480E9B162BF632959553" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="3">“(3)</num><heading> Reference.—</heading><content>Any reference to the Assistant Secretary for Cybersecurity and Communications in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Assistant Director for Cybersecurity.</content></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/b" id="HBB6676AB13104DD1924810ABFA2F1D86" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="b">“(b)</num><heading> Functions.—</heading><chapeau>The Assistant Director shall—</chapeau><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/b/1" id="H31C155AEE0DA46769B37F4750D656852" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="1">“(1)</num><content> direct the cybersecurity efforts of the Agency;</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/b/2" id="H76ED6BE1521043FB8DADA42DF7E221C7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="2">“(2)</num><content> carry out activities, at the direction of the Director, related to the security of Federal information and Federal information systems consistent with law, including subchapter II of <ref href="/us/usc-chapter/44/35">chapter 35</ref> of title 44, United States Code, and the Cybersecurity Act of 2015 (contained in division N of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2016 (<ref href="/us/pl/114/113">Public Law 114–113</ref>));</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/b/3" id="HB2A331658D7343F597F927E84354315C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="3">“(3)</num><content> fully participate in the mechanisms required under section 2202(c)(7); and</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2203/b/4" id="H11FAF92434884DEB89CDF768F69DB3E8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="4">“(4)</num><content> carry out such other duties and powers as prescribed by the Director.</content></paragraph></subsection></section><section identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204" id="H8358574154474597A0A53FCDFD296F97" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="2204">“Sec. 2204.</num><heading> Infrastructure security division</heading><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/a" id="H6883ECC58B6242C9BCD7DA6ABF17785D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="a">“(a)</num><heading> Establishment.—</heading><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/a/1" id="H6F4C9C0559384D8C89AD8F1212F69938" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="1">“(1)</num><heading> In general.—</heading><content>There is established in the Agency an Infrastructure Security Division.</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/a/2" id="H14EF7E46C5C44408AE3DE7F7C8EBD2DF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="7"><num value="2">“(2)</num><heading> Assistant director.—</heading><chapeau>The Infrastructure Security Division shall be headed by an Assistant Director for Infrastructure Security (in this section referred to as the <quotedContent>‘Assistant Director’</quotedContent>), who shall—</chapeau><?page 8?><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/a/2/A" id="HBE186EBE581B484EA36C090051BEA010" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="8"><num value="A">“(A)</num><content> be at the level of Assistant Secretary within the Department;</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/a/2/B" id="H22C310620F3F4E0D83665C7A63BE92CF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="8"><num value="B">“(B)</num><content> be appointed by the President without the advice and consent of the Senate; and</content></subparagraph><subparagraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/a/2/C" id="H6A667B3E24E847A9A8D73CEA9C7A8140" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="8"><num value="C">“(C)</num><content> report to the Director.</content></subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/a/3" id="H2E03DE17B92146DF8916FE25E48C186E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="8"><num value="3">“(3)</num><heading> Reference.—</heading><content>Any reference to the Assistant Secretary for Infrastructure Protection in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Assistant Director for Infrastructure Security.</content></paragraph></subsection><subsection identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/b" id="HCDD79CEC8A5344E5A63E70E7366855B6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="8"><num value="b">“(b)</num><heading> Functions.—</heading><chapeau>The Assistant Director shall—</chapeau><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/b/1" id="H47D203B92E5644DEA6DD8F5ED8FAFF06" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="8"><num value="1">“(1)</num><content> direct the critical infrastructure security efforts of the Agency;</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/b/2" id="H7A426F92172C4383A52A63B6AB5231D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="8"><num value="2">“(2)</num><content> carry out, at the direction of the Director, the Chemical Facilities Anti-Terrorism Standards Program established under title XXI and the secure handling of ammonium nitrate program established under subtitle J of title VIII, or any successor programs;</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/b/3" id="H02E167C3506B42C6BF99A09A1C40C4DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="8"><num value="3">“(3)</num><content> fully participate in the mechanisms required under section 2202(c)(7); and</content></paragraph><paragraph identifier="/s2/a/qB/tXXII/stA/s2204/b/4" id="HEB596222EAEC45F38E06CB89F10BBE7C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="8"><num value="4">“(4)</num><content> carry out such other duties and powers as prescribed by the Director.”.</content></paragraph></subsection></section></subtitle>
H2F44D10D26F14E9FA5F115E8AEF7CF26.text_card: The Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 101 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:In this subtitle:The term ‘critical infrastructure information’ has the meaning given the term in section 2222.The term ‘cybersecurity risk’ has the meaning given the term in section 2209.The term ‘cybersecurity threat’ has the meaning given the term in section 102(5) of the Cybersecurity Act of 2015 (contained in division N of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2016 (Public Law 114–113; 6 U.S.C. 1501)).The term ‘national cybersecurity asset response activities’ means— furnishing cybersecurity technical assistance to entities affected by cybersecurity risks to protect assets, mitigate vulnerabilities, and reduce impacts of cyber incidents; identifying other entities that may be at risk of an incident and assessing risk to the same or similar vulnerabilities; assessing potential cybersecurity risks to a sector or region, including potential cascading effects, and developing courses of action to mitigate such risks; facilitating information sharing and operational coordination with threat response; and providing guidance on how best to utilize Federal resources and capabilities in a timely, effective manner to speed recovery from cybersecurity risks.The term ‘Sector-Specific Agency’ means a Federal department or agency, designated by law or presidential directive, with responsibility for providing institutional knowledge and specialized expertise of a sector, as well as leading, facilitating, or supporting programs and associated activities of its designated critical infrastructure sector in the all hazards environment in coordination with the Department.The term ‘sharing’ has the meaning given the term in section 2209.The National Protection and Programs Directorate of the Department shall, on and after the date of the enactment of this subtitle, be known as the ‘Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency’ (in this subtitle referred to as the ‘Agency’).Any reference to the National Protection and Programs Directorate of the Department in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency of the Department.The Agency shall be headed by a Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security (in this subtitle referred to as the ‘Director’), who shall report to the Secretary.Any reference to an Under Secretary responsible for overseeing critical infrastructure protection, cybersecurity, and any other related program of the Department as described in section 103(a)(1)(H) as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of this subtitle in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security of the Department.The Director shall— lead cybersecurity and critical infrastructure security programs, operations, and associated policy for the Agency, including national cybersecurity asset response activities; coordinate with Federal entities, including Sector-Specific Agencies, and non-Federal entities, including international entities, to carry out the cybersecurity and critical infrastructure activities of the Agency, as appropriate; carry out the responsibilities of the Secretary to secure Federal information and information systems consistent with law, including subchapter II of chapter 35 of title 44, United States Code, and the Cybersecurity Act of 2015 (contained in division N of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2016 (Public Law 114–113)); coordinate a national effort to secure and protect against critical infrastructure risks, consistent with subsection (e)(1)(E); upon request, provide analyses, expertise, and other technical assistance to critical infrastructure owners and operators and, where appropriate, provide those analyses, expertise, and other technical assistance in coordination with Sector-Specific Agencies and other Federal departments and agencies; develop and utilize mechanisms for active and frequent collaboration between the Agency and Sector-Specific Agencies to ensure appropriate coordination, situational awareness, and communications with Sector-Specific Agencies; maintain and utilize mechanisms for the regular and ongoing consultation and collaboration among the Divisions of the Agency to further operational coordination, integrated situational awareness, and improved integration across the Agency in accordance with this Act; develop, coordinate, and implement— comprehensive strategic plans for the activities of the Agency; and risk assessments by and for the Agency; carry out emergency communications responsibilities, in accordance with title XVIII; carry out cybersecurity, infrastructure security, and emergency communications stakeholder outreach and engagement and coordinate that outreach and engagement with critical infrastructure Sector-Specific Agencies, as appropriate; and carry out such other duties and powers prescribed by law or delegated by the Secretary.There shall be in the Agency a Deputy Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security who shall— assist the Director in the management of the Agency; and report to the Director.The responsibilities of the Secretary relating to cybersecurity and infrastructure security shall include the following: To access, receive, and analyze law enforcement information, intelligence information, and other information from Federal Government agencies, State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies, including law enforcement agencies, and private sector entities, and to integrate that information, in support of the mission responsibilities of the Department, in order to— identify and assess the nature and scope of terrorist threats to the homeland; detect and identify threats of terrorism against the United States; and understand those threats in light of actual and potential vulnerabilities of the homeland. To carry out comprehensive assessments of the vulnerabilities of the key resources and critical infrastructure of the United States, including the performance of risk assessments to determine the risks posed by particular types of terrorist attacks within the United States, including an assessment of the probability of success of those attacks and the feasibility and potential efficacy of various countermeasures to those attacks. At the discretion of the Secretary, such assessments may be carried out in coordination with Sector-Specific Agencies. To integrate relevant information, analysis, and vulnerability assessments, regardless of whether the information, analysis, or assessments are provided or produced by the Department, in order to make recommendations, including prioritization, for protective and support measures by the Department, other Federal Government agencies, State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and authorities, the private sector, and other entities regarding terrorist and other threats to homeland security. To ensure, pursuant to section 202, the timely and efficient access by the Department to all information necessary to discharge the responsibilities under this title, including obtaining that information from other Federal Government agencies. To develop, in coordination with the Sector-Specific Agencies with available expertise, a comprehensive national plan for securing the key resources and critical infrastructure of the United States, including power production, generation, and distribution systems, information technology and telecommunications systems (including satellites), electronic financial and property record storage and transmission systems, emergency communications systems, and the physical and technological assets that support those systems. To recommend measures necessary to protect the key resources and critical infrastructure of the United States in coordination with other Federal Government agencies, including Sector-Specific Agencies, and in cooperation with State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and authorities, the private sector, and other entities. To review, analyze, and make recommendations for improvements to the policies and procedures governing the sharing of information relating to homeland security within the Federal Government and between Federal Government agencies and State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and authorities. To disseminate, as appropriate, information analyzed by the Department within the Department to other Federal Government agencies with responsibilities relating to homeland security and to State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and private sector entities with those responsibilities in order to assist in the deterrence, prevention, or preemption of, or response to, terrorist attacks against the United States. To consult with State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies and private sector entities to ensure appropriate exchanges of information, including law enforcement-related information, relating to threats of terrorism against the United States. To ensure that any material received pursuant to this Act is protected from unauthorized disclosure and handled and used only for the performance of official duties. To request additional information from other Federal Government agencies, State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies, and the private sector relating to threats of terrorism in the United States, or relating to other areas of responsibility assigned by the Secretary, including the entry into cooperative agreements through the Secretary to obtain such information. To establish and utilize, in conjunction with the Chief Information Officer of the Department, a secure communications and information technology infrastructure, including data-mining and other advanced analytical tools, in order to access, receive, and analyze data and information in furtherance of the responsibilities under this section, and to disseminate information acquired and analyzed by the Department, as appropriate. To coordinate training and other support to the elements and personnel of the Department, other Federal Government agencies, and State, local, tribal, and territorial government agencies that provide information to the Department, or are consumers of information provided by the Department, in order to facilitate the identification and sharing of information revealed in their ordinary duties and the optimal utilization of information received from the Department. To coordinate with Federal, State, local, tribal, and territorial law enforcement agencies, and the private sector, as appropriate. To exercise the authorities and oversight of the functions, personnel, assets, and liabilities of those components transferred to the Department pursuant to section 201(g). To carry out the functions of the national cybersecurity and communications integration center under section 2209. To carry out the requirements of the Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism Standards Program established under title XXI and the secure handling of ammonium nitrate program established under subtitle J of title VIII, or any successor programs.The Secretary may reallocate within the Agency the functions specified in sections 2203(b) and 2204(b), consistent with the responsibilities provided in paragraph (1), upon certifying to and briefing the appropriate congressional committees, and making available to the public, at least 60 days prior to the reallocation that the reallocation is necessary for carrying out the activities of the Agency.The Secretary shall provide the Agency with a staff of analysts having appropriate expertise and experience to assist the Agency in discharging the responsibilities of the Agency under this section.Analysts under this subsection may include analysts from the private sector.Analysts under this subsection shall possess security clearances appropriate for their work under this section.In order to assist the Agency in discharging the responsibilities of the Agency under this section, personnel of the Federal agencies described in subparagraph (B) may be detailed to the Agency for the performance of analytic functions and related duties.The Federal agencies described in this subparagraph are— the Department of State; the Central Intelligence Agency; the Federal Bureau of Investigation; the National Security Agency; the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency; the Defense Intelligence Agency; Sector-Specific Agencies; and any other agency of the Federal Government that the President considers appropriate.The Secretary and the head of a Federal agency described in subparagraph (B) may enter into agreements for the purpose of detailing personnel under this paragraph.The detail of personnel under this paragraph may be on a reimbursable or non-reimbursable basis.The Agency shall be composed of the following divisions: The Cybersecurity Division, headed by an Assistant Director. The Infrastructure Security Division, headed by an Assistant Director. The Emergency Communications Division under title XVIII, headed by an Assistant Director.To the maximum extent practicable, the Director shall examine the establishment of central locations in geographical regions with a significant Agency presence.When establishing the central locations described in paragraph (1), the Director shall coordinate with component heads and the Under Secretary for Management to co-locate or partner on any new real property leases, renewing any occupancy agreements for existing leases, or agreeing to extend or newly occupy any Federal space or new construction.There shall be a Privacy Officer of the Agency with primary responsibility for privacy policy and compliance for the Agency.The responsibilities of the Privacy Officer of the Agency shall include— assuring that the use of technologies by the Agency sustain, and do not erode, privacy protections relating to the use, collection, and disclosure of personal information; assuring that personal information contained in systems of records of the Agency is handled in full compliance as specified in section 552a of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the ‘Privacy Act of 1974’); evaluating legislative and regulatory proposals involving collection, use, and disclosure of personal information by the Agency; and conducting a privacy impact assessment of proposed rules of the Agency on the privacy of personal information, including the type of personal information collected and the number of people affected.Nothing in this title may be construed as affecting in any manner the authority, existing on the day before the date of enactment of this title, of any other component of the Department or any other Federal department or agency, including the authority provided to the Sector-Specific Agency specified in section 61003(c) of division F of the Fixing America’s Surface Transportation Act (6 U.S.C. 121 note; Public Law 114–94).There is established in the Agency a Cybersecurity Division.The Cybersecurity Division shall be headed by an Assistant Director for Cybersecurity (in this section referred to as the ‘Assistant Director’), who shall— be at the level of Assistant Secretary within the Department; be appointed by the President without the advice and consent of the Senate; and report to the Director.Any reference to the Assistant Secretary for Cybersecurity and Communications in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Assistant Director for Cybersecurity.The Assistant Director shall— direct the cybersecurity efforts of the Agency; carry out activities, at the direction of the Director, related to the security of Federal information and Federal information systems consistent with law, including subchapter II of chapter 35 of title 44, United States Code, and the Cybersecurity Act of 2015 (contained in division N of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2016 (Public Law 114–113)); fully participate in the mechanisms required under section 2202(c)(7); and carry out such other duties and powers as prescribed by the Director.There is established in the Agency an Infrastructure Security Division.The Infrastructure Security Division shall be headed by an Assistant Director for Infrastructure Security (in this section referred to as the ‘Assistant Director’), who shall— be at the level of Assistant Secretary within the Department; be appointed by the President without the advice and consent of the Senate; and report to the Director.Any reference to the Assistant Secretary for Infrastructure Protection in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Assistant Director for Infrastructure Security.The Assistant Director shall— direct the critical infrastructure security efforts of the Agency; carry out, at the direction of the Director, the Chemical Facilities Anti-Terrorism Standards Program established under title XXI and the secure handling of ammonium nitrate program established under subtitle J of title VIII, or any successor programs; fully participate in the mechanisms required under section 2202(c)(7); and carry out such other duties and powers as prescribed by the Director.”.

HCEE9433F22F54AE584C77E341FB9DABC.author: auto

H3612C626601B4429995E5236E556434F.text: To carry out comprehensive assessments of the vulnerabilities of the key resources and critical infrastructure of the United States, including the performance of risk assessments to determine the risks posed by particular types of terrorist attacks within the United States, including an assessment of the probability of success of those attacks and the feasibility and potential efficacy of various countermeasures to those attacks. At the discretion of the Secretary, such assessments may be carried out in coordination with Sector-Specific Agencies.

H6A5836E5685D4EEBBEFA6DB42C165105.author: auto

H849ACDC1E8064F73B599CED6C6162A5F.text: The Secretary shall provide the Agency with a staff of analysts having appropriate expertise and experience to assist the Agency in discharging the responsibilities of the Agency under this section.
H849ACDC1E8064F73B599CED6C6162A5F.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(e)(3)(A)"
H849ACDC1E8064F73B599CED6C6162A5F.author: auto

H2A8CA82EC43F40A78F4F1490E2A5C32C.text: Analysts under this subsection may include analysts from the private sector.
H2A8CA82EC43F40A78F4F1490E2A5C32C.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(e)(3)(B)"
H2A8CA82EC43F40A78F4F1490E2A5C32C.author: auto

HAB526A5AF8D648008D5DDD1C7D145112.text: Analysts under this subsection shall possess security clearances appropriate for their work under this section.
HAB526A5AF8D648008D5DDD1C7D145112.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(e)(3)(C)"
HAB526A5AF8D648008D5DDD1C7D145112.author: auto

H495018EA54C54667A07CDA9708514ED8.text: In order to assist the Agency in discharging the responsibilities of the Agency under this section, personnel of the Federal agencies described in subparagraph (B) may be detailed to the Agency for the performance of analytic functions and related duties.
H495018EA54C54667A07CDA9708514ED8.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(e)(4)(A)"
H495018EA54C54667A07CDA9708514ED8.author: auto

H2D65EA1C9FA84B9ABF75DC0C8DF14E84.text: The Federal agencies described in this subparagraph are—
H2D65EA1C9FA84B9ABF75DC0C8DF14E84.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(e)(4)(B)"
H2D65EA1C9FA84B9ABF75DC0C8DF14E84.author: auto

H055797742945489F82C2BB13E07C351A.text: any other agency of the Federal Government that the President considers appropriate.
H055797742945489F82C2BB13E07C351A.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(e)(4)(B)(viii)"
H055797742945489F82C2BB13E07C351A.author: auto

H742251398D8B4645BC45B828078CF97A.text: The Secretary and the head of a Federal agency described in subparagraph (B) may enter into agreements for the purpose of detailing personnel under this paragraph.
H742251398D8B4645BC45B828078CF97A.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(e)(4)(C)"
H742251398D8B4645BC45B828078CF97A.author: auto

HB5A918633DFE4313BFAF47174F7875F1.text: The detail of personnel under this paragraph may be on a reimbursable or non-reimbursable basis.
HB5A918633DFE4313BFAF47174F7875F1.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(e)(4)(D)"
HB5A918633DFE4313BFAF47174F7875F1.author: auto

H2D79DEDE767A49D78E92EC2553E620D4.text: The Agency shall be composed of the following divisions:
H2D79DEDE767A49D78E92EC2553E620D4.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(f)"
H2D79DEDE767A49D78E92EC2553E620D4.author: auto

HA27D01C93E8E41268BC59D8AF991D941.text: The Cybersecurity Division, headed by an Assistant Director.
HA27D01C93E8E41268BC59D8AF991D941.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(f)(1)"
HA27D01C93E8E41268BC59D8AF991D941.author: auto

HD6B1726E7F4347B6B47B6FA7A586A735.text: The Infrastructure Security Division, headed by an Assistant Director.
HD6B1726E7F4347B6B47B6FA7A586A735.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(f)(2)"
HD6B1726E7F4347B6B47B6FA7A586A735.author: auto

H42196CEF3FC042B18F10F7860C4254DB.text: The Emergency Communications Division under title XVIII, headed by an Assistant Director.
H42196CEF3FC042B18F10F7860C4254DB.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(f)(3)"
H42196CEF3FC042B18F10F7860C4254DB.author: auto

H9DF9EF0AB1D84759AA94847B7DAF5D3A.text: To the maximum extent practicable, the Director shall examine the establishment of central locations in geographical regions with a significant Agency presence.
H9DF9EF0AB1D84759AA94847B7DAF5D3A.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(g)(1)"
H9DF9EF0AB1D84759AA94847B7DAF5D3A.author: auto

HC519B4DC23D247849FA753247B1B78EA.text: When establishing the central locations described in paragraph (1), the Director shall coordinate with component heads and the Under Secretary for Management to co-locate or partner on any new real property leases, renewing any occupancy agreements for existing leases, or agreeing to extend or newly occupy any Federal space or new construction.
HC519B4DC23D247849FA753247B1B78EA.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(g)(2)"
HC519B4DC23D247849FA753247B1B78EA.author: auto

HD22A32E7211F49B397CB0EFC6449024A.text: There shall be a Privacy Officer of the Agency with primary responsibility for privacy policy and compliance for the Agency.
HD22A32E7211F49B397CB0EFC6449024A.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(h)(1)"
HD22A32E7211F49B397CB0EFC6449024A.author: auto

H6B7B27D3221244F19DC45EACF2070F18.text: The responsibilities of the Privacy Officer of the Agency shall include—
H6B7B27D3221244F19DC45EACF2070F18.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(h)(2)"
H6B7B27D3221244F19DC45EACF2070F18.author: auto

H4BEAAED4595A45A8A9318EF54814700C.text: assuring that the use of technologies by the Agency sustain, and do not erode, privacy protections relating to the use, collection, and disclosure of personal information;
H4BEAAED4595A45A8A9318EF54814700C.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(h)(2)(A)"
H4BEAAED4595A45A8A9318EF54814700C.author: auto

HD433FF2B4B304961B3B6718ED8AF77B7.text: assuring that personal information contained in systems of records of the Agency is handled in full compliance as specified in section 552a of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the ‘Privacy Act of 1974’);
HD433FF2B4B304961B3B6718ED8AF77B7.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(h)(2)(B)"
HD433FF2B4B304961B3B6718ED8AF77B7.author: auto

H7334B9AF28A64AF292BA5443FBCE40B5.text: evaluating legislative and regulatory proposals involving collection, use, and disclosure of personal information by the Agency; and
H7334B9AF28A64AF292BA5443FBCE40B5.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(h)(2)(C)"
H7334B9AF28A64AF292BA5443FBCE40B5.author: auto

H35167F8072B34E5FAF2714AA302B2D8B.text: conducting a privacy impact assessment of proposed rules of the Agency on the privacy of personal information, including the type of personal information collected and the number of people affected.
H35167F8072B34E5FAF2714AA302B2D8B.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(h)(2)(D)"
H35167F8072B34E5FAF2714AA302B2D8B.author: auto

HC4776D038BE84FCAA5A9410E8F590579.text: Nothing in this title may be construed as affecting in any manner the authority, existing on the day before the date of enactment of this title, of any other component of the Department or any other Federal department or agency, including the authority provided to the Sector-Specific Agency specified in section 61003(c) of division F of the Fixing America’s Surface Transportation Act (6 U.S.C. 121 note; Public Law 114–94).
HC4776D038BE84FCAA5A9410E8F590579.label: 2(a) "stA 2202(i)"
HC4776D038BE84FCAA5A9410E8F590579.author: auto

HF4F4D59573CF4AEC819BB43380B75090.text: There is established in the Agency a Cybersecurity Division.
HF4F4D59573CF4AEC819BB43380B75090.label: 2(a) "stA 2203(a)(1)"
HF4F4D59573CF4AEC819BB43380B75090.author: auto

H7E9BDA64235A4365B8BDC980ED430B39.text: The Cybersecurity Division shall be headed by an Assistant Director for Cybersecurity (in this section referred to as the ‘Assistant Director’), who shall—
H7E9BDA64235A4365B8BDC980ED430B39.label: 2(a) "stA 2203(a)(2)"
H7E9BDA64235A4365B8BDC980ED430B39.author: auto

H8ED5ED65EED54405B44AAF872B20BDD6.text: be at the level of Assistant Secretary within the Department;
H8ED5ED65EED54405B44AAF872B20BDD6.label: 2(a) "stA 2203(a)(2)(A)"
H8ED5ED65EED54405B44AAF872B20BDD6.author: auto

HCDF9A8EB5E7846AFA2A5D6C578B86549.text: be appointed by the President without the advice and consent of the Senate; and
HCDF9A8EB5E7846AFA2A5D6C578B86549.label: 2(a) "stA 2203(a)(2)(B)"
HCDF9A8EB5E7846AFA2A5D6C578B86549.author: auto

H708F635802C9480E9B162BF632959553.text: Any reference to the Assistant Secretary for Cybersecurity and Communications in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Assistant Director for Cybersecurity.
H708F635802C9480E9B162BF632959553.label: 2(a) "stA 2203(a)(3)"
H708F635802C9480E9B162BF632959553.author: auto

H31C155AEE0DA46769B37F4750D656852.text: direct the cybersecurity efforts of the Agency;
H31C155AEE0DA46769B37F4750D656852.label: 2(a) "stA 2203(b)(1)"
H31C155AEE0DA46769B37F4750D656852.author: auto

H76ED6BE1521043FB8DADA42DF7E221C7.text: carry out activities, at the direction of the Director, related to the security of Federal information and Federal information systems consistent with law, including subchapter II of chapter 35 of title 44, United States Code, and the Cybersecurity Act of 2015 (contained in division N of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2016 (Public Law 114–113));
H76ED6BE1521043FB8DADA42DF7E221C7.label: 2(a) "stA 2203(b)(2)"
H76ED6BE1521043FB8DADA42DF7E221C7.author: auto

HB2A331658D7343F597F927E84354315C.text: fully participate in the mechanisms required under section 2202(c)(7); and
HB2A331658D7343F597F927E84354315C.label: 2(a) "stA 2203(b)(3)"
HB2A331658D7343F597F927E84354315C.author: auto

H11FAF92434884DEB89CDF768F69DB3E8.text: carry out such other duties and powers as prescribed by the Director.
H11FAF92434884DEB89CDF768F69DB3E8.label: 2(a) "stA 2203(b)(4)"
H11FAF92434884DEB89CDF768F69DB3E8.author: auto

H6F4C9C0559384D8C89AD8F1212F69938.text: There is established in the Agency an Infrastructure Security Division.
H6F4C9C0559384D8C89AD8F1212F69938.label: 2(a) "stA 2204(a)(1)"
H6F4C9C0559384D8C89AD8F1212F69938.author: auto

H14EF7E46C5C44408AE3DE7F7C8EBD2DF.text: The Infrastructure Security Division shall be headed by an Assistant Director for Infrastructure Security (in this section referred to as the ‘Assistant Director’), who shall—
H14EF7E46C5C44408AE3DE7F7C8EBD2DF.label: 2(a) "stA 2204(a)(2)"
H14EF7E46C5C44408AE3DE7F7C8EBD2DF.author: auto

HBE186EBE581B484EA36C090051BEA010.text: be at the level of Assistant Secretary within the Department;
HBE186EBE581B484EA36C090051BEA010.label: 2(a) "stA 2204(a)(2)(A)"
HBE186EBE581B484EA36C090051BEA010.author: auto

H22C310620F3F4E0D83665C7A63BE92CF.text: be appointed by the President without the advice and consent of the Senate; and
H22C310620F3F4E0D83665C7A63BE92CF.label: 2(a) "stA 2204(a)(2)(B)"
H22C310620F3F4E0D83665C7A63BE92CF.author: auto

H2E03DE17B92146DF8916FE25E48C186E.text: Any reference to the Assistant Secretary for Infrastructure Protection in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Assistant Director for Infrastructure Security.
H2E03DE17B92146DF8916FE25E48C186E.label: 2(a) "stA 2204(a)(3)"
H2E03DE17B92146DF8916FE25E48C186E.author: auto

H47D203B92E5644DEA6DD8F5ED8FAFF06.text: direct the critical infrastructure security efforts of the Agency;
H47D203B92E5644DEA6DD8F5ED8FAFF06.label: 2(a) "stA 2204(b)(1)"
H47D203B92E5644DEA6DD8F5ED8FAFF06.author: auto

H7A426F92172C4383A52A63B6AB5231D6.text: carry out, at the direction of the Director, the Chemical Facilities Anti-Terrorism Standards Program established under title XXI and the secure handling of ammonium nitrate program established under subtitle J of title VIII, or any successor programs;
H7A426F92172C4383A52A63B6AB5231D6.label: 2(a) "stA 2204(b)(2)"
H7A426F92172C4383A52A63B6AB5231D6.author: auto

H02E167C3506B42C6BF99A09A1C40C4DE.text: fully participate in the mechanisms required under section 2202(c)(7); and
H02E167C3506B42C6BF99A09A1C40C4DE.label: 2(a) "stA 2204(b)(3)"
H02E167C3506B42C6BF99A09A1C40C4DE.author: auto

HEB596222EAEC45F38E06CB89F10BBE7C.text: carry out such other duties and powers as prescribed by the Director.”.
HEB596222EAEC45F38E06CB89F10BBE7C.label: 2(a) "stA 2204(b)(4)"
HEB596222EAEC45F38E06CB89F10BBE7C.author: auto

HEBD6C64730B34CB7AD192BA9BB1BBE37.text: The individual serving as the Under Secretary appointed pursuant to section 103(a)(1)(H) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 113(a)(1)(H)) of the Department of Homeland Security on the day before the date of enactment of this Act may continue to serve as the Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security of the Department on and after such date.
HEBD6C64730B34CB7AD192BA9BB1BBE37.label: 2(b)(1)
HEBD6C64730B34CB7AD192BA9BB1BBE37.author: jwagner

H31617E53BA5F4DDC8104F416FB5C85ED.text: The individual serving as the Director for Emergency Communications of the Department of Homeland Security on the day before the date of enactment of this Act may continue to serve as the Assistant Director for Emergency Communications of the Department on and after such date.
H31617E53BA5F4DDC8104F416FB5C85ED.label: 2(b)(2)
H31617E53BA5F4DDC8104F416FB5C85ED.author: jwagner

H50C6DD69706E4BAF95FDF75F41D191F6.text: The individual serving as the Assistant Secretary for Cybersecurity and Communications on the day before the date of enactment of this Act may continue to serve as the Assistant Director for Cybersecurity on and after such date.
H50C6DD69706E4BAF95FDF75F41D191F6.label: 2(b)(3)
H50C6DD69706E4BAF95FDF75F41D191F6.author: jwagner

H0097A8CE17BE47C685B603F181CB2402.text: The individual serving as the Assistant Secretary for Infrastructure Protection on the day before the date of enactment of this Act may continue to serve as the Assistant Director for Infrastructure Security on and after such date.
H0097A8CE17BE47C685B603F181CB2402.label: 2(b)(4)
H0097A8CE17BE47C685B603F181CB2402.author: jwagner

H68F66B066EAE4B4FA6535A50D36C5627.text: the Office of Emergency Communications in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Emergency Communications Division; and
H68F66B066EAE4B4FA6535A50D36C5627.label: 2(c)(1)
H68F66B066EAE4B4FA6535A50D36C5627.author: auto

H942AD09C77DD40A0AB5D08C1F7C01476.text: the Director for Emergency Communications in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be deemed to be a reference to the Assistant Director for Emergency Communications.
H942AD09C77DD40A0AB5D08C1F7C01476.label: 2(c)(2)
H942AD09C77DD40A0AB5D08C1F7C01476.author: auto

HD472E15374BC4BE6AC21176740E456AC.text: The Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security of the Department of Homeland Security shall provide to Congress, in accordance with the deadlines specified in paragraphs (1) through (6), information on the following:
HD472E15374BC4BE6AC21176740E456AC.label: 2(d)
HD472E15374BC4BE6AC21176740E456AC.author: auto

H25A614CCD1CE478399A6876189D5DDFE.text: Not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, a briefing on the activities of the Agency relating to the development and use of the mechanisms required pursuant to section 2202(c)(6) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (as added by subsection (a)).
H25A614CCD1CE478399A6876189D5DDFE.label: 2(d)(1)
H25A614CCD1CE478399A6876189D5DDFE.author: auto

H112998282AA14733B4323B6DAD2C1F90.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, a briefing on the activities of the Agency relating to the use and improvement by the Agency of the mechanisms required pursuant to section 2202(c)(6) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 and how such activities have impacted coordination, situational awareness, and communications with Sector-Specific Agencies.
H112998282AA14733B4323B6DAD2C1F90.label: 2(d)(2)
H112998282AA14733B4323B6DAD2C1F90.author: auto

H1C33FDD7A564459892CA3C4F8F74E562.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, information on the mechanisms of the Agency for regular and ongoing consultation and collaboration, as required pursuant to section 2202(c)(7) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (as added by subsection (a)).
H1C33FDD7A564459892CA3C4F8F74E562.label: 2(d)(3)
H1C33FDD7A564459892CA3C4F8F74E562.author: auto

H659C21A88DD646A092DAFA2E3235E8E0.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, information on the activities of the consultation and collaboration mechanisms of the Agency as required pursuant to section 2202(c)(7) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002, and how such mechanisms have impacted operational coordination, situational awareness, and integration across the Agency.
H659C21A88DD646A092DAFA2E3235E8E0.label: 2(d)(4)
H659C21A88DD646A092DAFA2E3235E8E0.author: auto

HF03534AACC064CB2AE9A610FF83821D1.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, information, which shall be made publicly available and updated as appropriate, on the mechanisms and structures of the Agency responsible for stakeholder outreach and engagement, as required under section 2202(c)(10) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (as added by subsection (a)).
HF03534AACC064CB2AE9A610FF83821D1.label: 2(d)(5)
HF03534AACC064CB2AE9A610FF83821D1.author: auto

HFB91DC7E22E64269BEBB55B7526A2ACB.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency of the Department of Homeland Security, in coordination with the Director of the Office of Personnel Management, shall submit to Congress a report detailing how the Agency is meeting legislative requirements under the Cybersecurity Workforce Assessment Act (Public Law 113–246; 128 Stat. 2880) and the Homeland Security Cybersecurity Workforce Assessment Act (enacted as section 4 of the Border Patrol Agent Pay Reform Act of 2014; Public Law 113–277) to address cyber workforce needs.
HFB91DC7E22E64269BEBB55B7526A2ACB.label: 2(e)
HFB91DC7E22E64269BEBB55B7526A2ACB.author: auto

H354F521A026A497CAF9BBEB54597B56D.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency of the Department of Homeland Security shall report to Congress on the most efficient and effective methods of consolidating Agency facilities, personnel, and programs to most effectively carry out the Agency’s mission.
H354F521A026A497CAF9BBEB54597B56D.label: 2(f)
H354F521A026A497CAF9BBEB54597B56D.author: auto

<section identifier="/s2" id="H39540F24FE1749ADB2F186FFCAF5D716" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1">
	<num value="2">Sec. 2.</num>
	<heading> Cybersecurity and infrastructure security agency</heading>

</section>

All decisions of the Assistant Director that entail the exercise of significant authority shall be subject to the approval of the Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security.”;</content></subsection></quotedContent></clause></subparagraph></paragraph></subsection></section>
H2A04BFD9DBA546A3B38E0D9BBB7DD1DF.text_card: The Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 101 et seq.) is amended— in title XVIII (6 U.S.C. 571 et seq.)— in section 1801 (6 U.S.C. 571)— by amending subsection (b) to read as follows:The head of the Division shall be the Assistant Director for Emergency Communications. The Assistant Director shall report to the Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security. All decisions of the Assistant Director that entail the exercise of significant authority shall be subject to the approval of the Director of Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security.”;
