H7522A976765E4305932087E5AA9E59E7.text_card: The table of contents in section 1(b) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (Public Law 107–296; 116 Stat. 2135) is amended— by adding at the end the following:
H7522A976765E4305932087E5AA9E59E7.label: 2(i)(11)
H7522A976765E4305932087E5AA9E59E7.author: auto

H36F64A10D7D84BC1861EB89CBECF8064.text: The Office of Biometric Identity Management of the Department of Homeland Security located in the National Protection and Programs Directorate of the Department of Homeland Security on the day before the date of enactment of this Act is hereby transferred to the Management Directorate of the Department.
H36F64A10D7D84BC1861EB89CBECF8064.label: 3(a)
H36F64A10D7D84BC1861EB89CBECF8064.author: auto

H9D44E6B6482D490EB4918A5DDF6AD00C.text: Not later than 90 days after the completion of the Government Accountability Office review of the organizational placement of the Federal Protective Service (authorized under section 1315 of title 40, United States Code), the Secretary of Homeland Security shall determine the appropriate placement of the Service within the Department of Homeland Security and commence the transfer of the Service to such component, directorate, or other office of the Department that the Secretary so determines appropriate.
H9D44E6B6482D490EB4918A5DDF6AD00C.label: 3(b)(1)
H9D44E6B6482D490EB4918A5DDF6AD00C.author: auto

H2C48DA019727425B8E8B0A9E3B4A95B6.text: If the Secretary of Homeland Security determines pursuant to paragraph (1) that no component, directorate, or other office of the Department of Homeland Security is an appropriate placement for the Federal Protective Service, the Secretary shall—
H2C48DA019727425B8E8B0A9E3B4A95B6.label: 3(b)(2)
H2C48DA019727425B8E8B0A9E3B4A95B6.author: auto

H149545EBDD46425083E4206C32DCBA08.text: provide to the Committee on Homeland Security and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate and the Office of Management and Budget a detailed explanation, in writing, of the reason for such determination that includes—
H149545EBDD46425083E4206C32DCBA08.label: 3(b)(2)(A)
H149545EBDD46425083E4206C32DCBA08.author: auto

H0966649350FA465889B7A6A56C12092B.text: information on how the Department considered the Government Accountability Office review described in such paragraph;
H0966649350FA465889B7A6A56C12092B.label: 3(b)(2)(A)(i)
H0966649350FA465889B7A6A56C12092B.author: auto

H6F253E515174449296DFABE23E8B028A.text: a list of the components, directorates, or other offices of the Department that were considered for such placement; and
H6F253E515174449296DFABE23E8B028A.label: 3(b)(2)(A)(ii)
H6F253E515174449296DFABE23E8B028A.author: auto

HEA740E92D0334EB586119E7E34C9448F.text: information on why each such component, directorate, or other office of the Department was determined to not be an appropriate placement for the Service;
HEA740E92D0334EB586119E7E34C9448F.label: 3(b)(2)(A)(iii)
HEA740E92D0334EB586119E7E34C9448F.author: auto

H2240108EFF74479AA53D52CC1193270B.text: not later than 120 days after the completion of the Government Accountability Office review described in such paragraph, develop and submit to the committees specified in subparagraph (A) and the Office of Management and Budget a plan to coordinate with other appropriate Federal agencies, including the General Services Administration, to determine a more appropriate placement for the Service; and
H2240108EFF74479AA53D52CC1193270B.label: 3(b)(2)(B)
H2240108EFF74479AA53D52CC1193270B.author: auto

HE00A8879C27E4A1D92103F100CD47414.text: not later than 180 days after the completion of such Government Accountability Office review, submit to such committees and the Office of Management and Budget a recommendation regarding the appropriate placement of the Service within the executive branch of the Federal Government.
HE00A8879C27E4A1D92103F100CD47414.label: 3(b)(2)(C)
HE00A8879C27E4A1D92103F100CD47414.author: auto

HAB05B721CB0E4659A2E1B2B4C028F901.text: In this section, the term “Department” means the Department of Homeland Security.
HAB05B721CB0E4659A2E1B2B4C028F901.label: 4(a)
HAB05B721CB0E4659A2E1B2B4C028F901.author: auto

H86EB9A35909544DE89ECAEA97784B4E6.text: Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Homeland Security, in coordination with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the Administrator of General Services, shall submit to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate and the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform and the Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives a report on the leadership role of the Department in cloud-based cybersecurity deployments for civilian Federal departments and agencies, which shall include—
H86EB9A35909544DE89ECAEA97784B4E6.label: 4(b)
H86EB9A35909544DE89ECAEA97784B4E6.author: auto

H76203FD9046040979D87771CC4DF4952.text: information on the plan of the Department for ensuring access to a security operations center as a service capability in accordance with the December 19, 2017 Report to the President on Federal IT Modernization issued by the American Technology Council;
H76203FD9046040979D87771CC4DF4952.label: 4(b)(1)
H76203FD9046040979D87771CC4DF4952.author: auto

H16D173D05F50476BBFFFE7E52A8611D9.text: information on what service capabilities under paragraph (1) the Department will prioritize, including—
H16D173D05F50476BBFFFE7E52A8611D9.label: 4(b)(2)
H16D173D05F50476BBFFFE7E52A8611D9.author: auto

HBCF945CE5F094E5EBF8AB0FECD5AF30D.text: criteria the Department will use to evaluate capabilities offered by the private sector; and
HBCF945CE5F094E5EBF8AB0FECD5AF30D.label: 4(b)(2)(A)
HBCF945CE5F094E5EBF8AB0FECD5AF30D.author: auto

HE232CCD6CFF94A88A6719F7F0B9E6804.text: how Federal government- and private sector-provided capabilities will be integrated to enable visibility and consistency of such capabilities across all cloud and on premise environments, as called for in the report described in paragraph (1); and
HE232CCD6CFF94A88A6719F7F0B9E6804.label: 4(b)(2)(B)
HE232CCD6CFF94A88A6719F7F0B9E6804.author: auto

H820EFBB42AB34981992E376789A4E091.text: information on how the Department will adapt the current capabilities of, and future enhancements to, the intrusion detection and prevention system of the Department and the Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation Program of the Department to secure civilian Federal government networks in a cloud environment.
H820EFBB42AB34981992E376789A4E091.label: 4(b)(3)
H820EFBB42AB34981992E376789A4E091.author: auto

H1D607651E6EC43A7B6ACFC287BD4C858.text: Nothing in this Act or an amendment made by this Act may be construed as—
H1D607651E6EC43A7B6ACFC287BD4C858.author: jwagner

HE3F40DA870464186B72B2984AABB55EE.text: conferring new authorities to the Secretary of Homeland Security, including programmatic, regulatory, or enforcement authorities, outside of the authorities in existence on the day before the date of enactment of this Act;
HE3F40DA870464186B72B2984AABB55EE.author: auto

H3B032B4B2E5245EBBD5D788CC2546700.text: reducing or limiting the programmatic, regulatory, or enforcement authority vested in any other Federal agency by statute; or
H3B032B4B2E5245EBBD5D788CC2546700.author: auto

H8E7B498578E04F4385B060D268DB70EF.text: affecting in any manner the authority, existing on the day before the date of enactment of this Act, of any other Federal agency or component of the Department of Homeland Security.
H8E7B498578E04F4385B060D268DB70EF.author: auto

H03519C1443CF454293DA1F231726656F.text: No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act or the amendments made by this Act. This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall be carried out using amounts otherwise authorized.
H03519C1443CF454293DA1F231726656F.author: auto
